item.title: Dev Blog - Hive Scum: Narrative & VO
item.description:
Hey everyone,

Hardened criminals, ruthless bounty hunters, violent psychopaths: Tertium‚Äôs Hive Scum are coming to Darktide as the next DLC class.

In case you missed it, check out the reveal trailer here.

This part of a series of dev blogs breaking down different aspects of the Hive Scum! Check out the previous dev blog here. For this one, we‚Äôve interviewed our writers Matthew Ward and Michael Knight about the narrative & lore of the class, as well as each of the Personalities that you can pick.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm Mike, I‚Äôm the Narrative Lead for Darktide, and I‚Äôve been with Fatshark for 3 years. \[...] When I‚Äôm not Narrative-ing for Darktide \[...] I have a massive Warhammer 40,000 and Horus Heresy collections that are still staring at me at about 40-50% grey‚Ä¶ Which I‚Äôm reasonably pleased about! Y‚Äôknow, that‚Äôs still a lot of minis painted.‚Äù ~ Mike

‚ÄúI‚Äôm Matthew, I‚Äôm the Lead Writer and VO (Voice Over) Director for Darktide, which means I write most of the words, I cast most of the actors and direct most of the recording sessions.‚Äù ~ Matthew

The Story
Who are the Hive Scum?

Born and raised in Tertium, the Hive Scum are true criminals. The real deal. Each is a high ranking and lethal footsoldier in service to one of the cartels that run the city‚Äôs underbelly.

‚ÄúThe cartels feel that they are the true rulers of Tertium. And the Hive Scum are their blademen and gunsmiths. These are the guys that do the wetwork. They‚Äôre the ones that settle the ‚Äòdisputes‚Äô with hyper-violence whenever required.‚Äù ~ Mike

While most don‚Äôt have formal military training, a lifetime surviving on these streets have taught them all they need to know to be killing machines, using unconventional weapons, toxins and underhanded tactics. And while some might deem them untrustworthy, they‚Äôve got plenty of reason to use those skills against the Heretics infesting Tertium.

‚ÄúThis is their home. More than any other character we‚Äôve introduced, these guys are all from Tertium, they‚Äôre from the Hive. This is their home that‚Äôs being destroyed.‚Äù ~ Mike

But make no mistake, Hive Scum are still dangerous, hardened criminals. Some might only be in it for the money, but a good amount of psychopaths are answering the call as well. Between them they have more than a few loose screws and a bit too much of an interest in bloodbaths.

Their place aboard the Mourningstar

The conflict in Tertium only keeps escalating. Every day there are new horrors to face, ever more virulent plagues, and a constant fight that seems to accomplish nothing but drain the Inquisition‚Äôs resources‚Ä¶ Even with the Adeptus Arbites providing reinforcements, the Warband needs help. Rannick instructed Explicator Zola to use her connections to the Water Cartel, establishing contact with a conclave of Cartel leaders and leveraging the Inquisition‚Äôs influence and their mutual enemy to mobilize their forces.

‚Äú...At least that‚Äôs what Rannick‚Äôs telling people.‚Äù ~ Matthew

Since the Hive Scum don‚Äôt come from a single organization, but vying cartels and criminal operations, they don‚Äôt have a representative on board to act as a figurehead. Zola, however reluctantly, has proven the ideal shepherd of this unreliable flock, but the Mourningstar has no shortage of shady characters, and sooner or later they're sure to get involved.

‚ÄúBut initially Zola is being the front of all this, isn‚Äôt she? She‚Äôs the one with the connections, specifically to the Water Cartel, and if nothing else‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt think she‚Äôs going to trust them at all when they‚Äôre out of her sight. So, that‚Äôs certainly where things will pick up. But where things head from there, who can say?‚Äù ~ Matthew

The Voices

‚ÄúAll these characters are from Tertium and it‚Äôs given us an opportunity to shine a little light on some of the bits of Tertium that we haven‚Äôt seen before. Particularly when you‚Äôre building your character. \[...] There will be tons of things for the lore hounds buried in there.‚Äù ~ Mike

Like most of our other classes, the Hive Scum have three distinct Personalities to choose from, with a male and female version of each. Each Personality, with their quirks, beliefs and opinions, have very different bonds or rivalries with the Rejects, their handlers, and with each other.

‚ÄúThe Ogryns tend to get on with everyone, because of course the Ogryns tend to get on with everyone. One of the Ogryns in particular \[‚Ä¶] if anything, he‚Äôs a little bit meaner than they are. \[...] but the Arbitrators are not particularly pleased to see the Hive Scum at all. And vice versa.‚Äù ~ Matthew

The Outlaw

Voiced by Gordon Cooper and Lizzie Wofford

Perhaps in other circumstances, in another life, the Outlaw might‚Äôve been a Hero‚Ä¶ Or perhaps that‚Äôs just what they want you to think. Whatever the case, this is one criminal that might make you believe that there can indeed be honour among thieves. Might be someone you‚Äôd enjoy having a drink with! Maybe. If you keep an eye on them.

The Bounty Hunter

Voiced by Theo Spofforth and Lucy Forrester

Guided by greed or just self-interest, the Bounty Hunter is in it for the money. Ruthless and efficient, they always get the job done and have plenty of experience. Neither hesitating to get their hands dirty, nor relishing in it: This way of life is strictly business. And profit. Lots of profit. At least, that was the case when the Cartels were operating normally, and the Outlaw does not take kindly to the Heretics‚Äô unwarranted disruption of their operations.

The Anarchist

Voiced by Ian Conningham and Jess Nesling

Were they drawn to the criminal life because of their lust for violence, or did they snap at some point along the way? Whatever the case, the Anarchist is chaos incarnate, and not someone that any sane person would trust‚Ä¶ even if we‚Äôre all on the same side now. The last voice you‚Äôd want to hear behind you in a dark alley‚Ä¶ And probably the last voice you‚Äôd ever hear if that came to happen.

Bonus: Favorite part of working with the Hive Scum

‚ÄúOur male and female characters \[of the same Personality] share something in the region of 80% of the same script depending on what we‚Äôre talking about, but hearing how the separation comes in through performance is absolutely splendid. Jess‚Äôs version \[of the Anarchist] sounds terrifying. Ian‚Äôs one sounds like he doesn‚Äôt understand why people think he‚Äôs terrifying. And that‚Äôs lovely.‚Äù ~ Matthew

‚ÄúI got to help Matt write some of \[the scripts] this time, which was quite nice. When we write the conversations we literally write them backwards and forwards. Like Matt will write a series of opening lines of conversation, then I will add in the next line and then Matt will reply to that. So we don't necessarily know where that conversation is going to go beyond the first line and they're really organic, but we get to throw in little nods to background and stuff like some of the other war band members asking about the Conclave \[...] It‚Äôs fun to throw those things in.‚Äù ~ Mike

That‚Äôs all for today, but keep an eye out for our next Dev Blog, coming soon!

For the Conclave!

Wishlist the Hive Scum here:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/4013290/Warhammer_40000_Darktide__Hive_Scum_Class/https://store.steampowered.com/app/4013310/Warhammer_40000_Darktide__Hive_Scum_Class_Deluxe_Edition/We‚Äôll see you on the Mourningstar.

‚Äì The Darktide Team

item.title: Vermintide 2 is FREE TO KEEP until November 24!
item.description:
Heroes!

We‚Äôre not done with the 10 Years of Tide celebrations just yet! Starting today and until November 24, Vermintide 2 is Free To Keep! Anyone with a Steam account may add it to their library and keep it forever, for free!

Whoever hasn't had the chance to play Warhammer: Vermintide 2 will now get to dig into the hectic, intense gameplay and discover the breadth of content that awaits them.

Throughout the years since its release in 2018, Vermintide 2 has expanded greatly and more than doubled its original content with several free DLCs, Quality of Life Updates, and new Game Modes such as Chaos Wastes and Versus.¬†

The latest addition to the game just released yesterday, with Return to the Reik - a fan-favourite location from Vermintide 1, expanded and re-imagined for Vermintide 2. In case you missed it, you can read all about it here.

Fangtastic Fortitude

And to have even more fun, we‚Äôve temporarily re-enabled the infectiousness of the Fangtastic Fortitude portrait frame! Starting today until November 30, winning a match where a teammate was wearing this frame will infect your account, adding it to your collection!

And don‚Äôt forget there‚Äôs Double XP running until November 30, as well!

item.title: Total War: WARHAMMER I & II: Immortal Empires Unlock
item.description:
Hi folks,

We‚Äôre excited to announce that on December 4th, Immortal Empires will become available to all owners of Total War: WARHAMMER I and II.



I. What are we doing?

We‚Äôre making Immortal Empires, as well as The Lost God prologue campaign, available for all owners of Total War: WARHAMMER I and II. If you own either of those games, Total War: WARHAMMER III will automatically be added to your library, with Immortal Empires and The Lost God campaign unlocked. If you already own WARHAMMER III, nothing will change for you.

II. Why are we doing it?

As we celebrate 25 incredible years of Total War - and look ahead to WARHAMMER‚Äôs 10th anniversary in 2026 - we wanted to do something special. Your passion and support for this trilogy have made Immortal Empires possible, and we couldn‚Äôt be more grateful. Now feels like the perfect moment to open its gates and invite everyone to experience a piece of the adventure.

III. When are we doing it?

On December the 4th at 1600 GMT.

IV. How will it work?

WARHAMMER I and II owners will have ‚ÄòTotal War: WARHAMMER III‚Äô automatically added to their libraries. Through this you will be able to access both The Lost God prologue campaign and Immortal Empires. Please note; even if you don‚Äôt own the full WARHAMMER III experience you can also purchase any of its associated DLCs to play in Immortal Empires.

There‚Äôs a lot more questions you‚Äôll have about how this works and what‚Äôs changing. For further details please see our FAQ below. If your question isn‚Äôt explicitly answered there please head over to our Discord where the community team will be on hand to help.

See you on the battlefield!

‚Äì The Total War Team



FAQ

1. When is Immortal Empires unlocking?

December the 4th.

2. Is Immortal Empires a standalone game?

No, you must own either Total War: WARHAMMER I, II or III in order to access Immortal Empires, and it will be accessible through the Total War: WARHAMMER III application in your Library.

3. Can I purchase any DLC from the trilogy regardless of which game I own?

Yes! For example; If you own WARHAMMER I, you can purchase DLC for WARHAMMER II and/or III and enjoy it within Immortal Empires. This makes it even easier to expand and tailor the experience to your liking.


4. What happens if I already own WARHAMMER III?

If you already own WARHAMMER III, your game experience will not change, and there is nothing you need to do in order to continue playing your owned content (but we would recommend recruiting a friend or seven and getting a co-op campaign rolling).

5. What has changed with this update?

The primary change in this update is that owners of Total War: WARHAMMER I & II will now have access to Immortal Empires and The Lost God campaign from WARHAMMER III.

6. How do I access Immortal Empires from within WARHAMMER I and II?

You don‚Äôt. Immortal Empires will not appear as a game mode in WARHAMMER I or II. In order to access Immortal Empires you will need to launch Total War: WARHAMMER III from your Steam or Epic Games library, which will be added to your library as part of this update.

7. What am I gaining access to if I do not own Warhammer III?

No. If you only own WARHAMMER I & II, you are only gaining access to the Immortal Empires campaign and The Lost God prologue campaign. If you wish to own the other WARHAMMER III content such as the Realms of Chaos campaign and the Legendary Lords and their associated features, you must purchase the Total War: WARHAMMER III Upgrade Pack.

8. How do I get access to WARHAMMER III‚Äôs other content?

If you only own WARHAMMER I and/or II, you can purchase the WARHAMMER III Upgrade Pack to expand your gameplay experience. This pack includes:

10 Legendary Lords, and all of their associated units and features.

The Realm of Chaos narrative campaign

Multiplayer campaigns: The Realm of Chaos, Something Rotten in Kislev and Darkness & Disharmony

Mirrors of Madness game mode

9. How do I remove Total War: WARHAMMER III from my Library if I don‚Äôt want it?

Follow the usual procedure for removing a game from your library by contacting Steam, Epic or Microsoft store support.

10. How is Immortal Empires different from WARHAMMER I?

Immortal Empires features a massively expanded map containing all of regions from the entire trilogy. Rebuilt from the ground up, its the biggest Total War sandbox ever made. is the culmination of a decade of the Total War: Warhammer franchise, and the ultimate way to play it.

11. Does this mean my PC meets the requirements of WARHAMMER III?

Please check the Total War: WARHAMMER III Upgrade Pack page to see the minimum specs needed to play Immortal Empires and The Lost God campaigns.

12. Which parts of Total War: Warhammer III‚Äôs multiplayer can I now access?

If you only own Total War: WARHAMMER I & II, you can play Immortal Empires in co-op multiplayer with up to 7 friends.

If you wish to play multiplayer battles, you will need to purchase the WARHAMMER III Upgrade Pack.

13. Does this impact Family Sharing via Steam.

No, you‚Äôll be able to continue sharing your Total War: WARHAMMER content via this mechanism as normal.

This list is not exhaustive and if you have any further questions please jump into our Discord where our community team will try to get any query answered as soon as possible. For any technical issues please submit a report through our Bug Reporting Forum here.
